oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Synthesis of nanodimensional TiO2 thin films
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: THAKURDESAI, M
MOHANTY, T
JOHN, J
RAO, TKG
RAYCHAUDHURI, P
BHATTACHARYYA, V
KANJILAL, D
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: track formation
ion beams
deposition
nanodimensional tio2
electronic excitation
afm
raman spectroscopy
uv-vis spectroscopy
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Nanodimensional TiO2 has wide application in the field of photocatalysis, photovoltaic and photochromic devices. In present investigation TiO2 thin films deposited by pulsed laser deposition method are irradiated by 100 MeV Ag ion beam to achieve growth of nanophases. The nanostructure evolution is characterized by atomic force microscopy (AFM). The phases of TiO2 formed after irradiation are identified by glancing angle X-ray diffraction and Raman spectroscopy. The particle radius estimated by AFM varies from 10-13 nm. Anatase phase of TiO2 is formed after irradiation. The blue shift observed in UV-VIS absorption spectra indicates the nanostructure formation. The shape and size of nanoparticles formed due to high electronic excitation depend upon thickness of the film.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: International Conference on Advanced Nano-Materials,Bombay, INDIA,JAN 08-10, 2007
